result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M Orlando was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid along with costs at $50.00 per month commencing 7/15/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 13 days jail for non-payment.

15CM1721 dismissed and read in.

Costs to be paid along with fine.

*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Orlando

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicole M Orlando in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   FINE:   $442.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 7/15/16, alternate 13 days jail if not paid)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
(Fax) Dated today, from Atty Kershek to Judge Carter, requesring to have jury status on 06/15 instead of 06/16.  Sent to Judge Carter for review.

Defendant Nicole M Orlando in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjourned date as he is still in negotiations with the state.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Defendant Nicole M Orlando in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
